trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of Highly Selective-a-1A-Adrenoceptor Antagonist Silodosin in Expulsive Therapy of Lower Ureteral Stones: A Randomized Controlled Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Efficacy of highly selective-a-1A-adrenoceptor antagonist in expulsive therapy of lower ureteral stones

interventions.interventions: orally highly selective a-1A blocker(silodosin 4 mg and tamsulosin 0.2 mg) once daily for 2 weeks
interventions.comparator: lactose tablet orally once daily for 2 weeks

primaryOutcome.timepoint: reported by patient diaries or Stone presence and characteristics were diagnosed through x-ray of kidney-ureter-bladder, abdominal ultrasonography, intravenous urography and nonenhenced CT at 2 weeks.
Stone presence and characteristics were diagnosed through x-ray of kidney-ureter-bladder, abdominal ultrasonography, intravenous urography and nonenhenced CT at 2 weeks.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: recorded by patient(All patients were prescribed ketorolac 10 mg three time per day for analgesic use and allowed to use sublingual buprenorphine 0.2 mg on demand) at 2 weeks
recorded by patient diaries daily for 2 weeks
dizziness,postural hypotension by patient diaries daily for 2 weeks

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: symptomatic radiopaque lower ureteral stones >5mm aged between 20 and 60 years old
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Subjects with urinary tract infections, high-grade hydronephrosis, diabetes, ulcers, or a history of hypersensitivity toa-1 blocker and pregnant women were excluded. Patients with a history of spontaneous stone expulsion, hypotension, or those found to have systolic blood pressure lower than 110 mmHg were also excluded.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 600 No 565 Rd Ta-Ya Chia-Yi city, Taiwan, ROC St Martin De Porres Hospital

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 600 No 565 Rd Ta-Ya Chia-Yi city, Taiwan,ROC St Martin De Porres Hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: a comparative study to evaluate the clinical role of highly selective a-1A blocker in the medical expulsive therapy of symptomatic lower ureteral stones.
